lead_paragraph: SISKIND--Beth, (formerly of Scarsdale, NY), on the morning of January 25, 2016 in her New York City home. Born Beth Diana Mohel August 10, 1940, she spent her first 18 years in New Bedford, MA, graduated from New Bedford High School and earned a bachelor's degree at Skidmore College (1962). A high- light of her time at Skidmore was an 11-week trip to Europe's Festivals of Art and Music which she financed through her successful investments in the stock market beginning at the age of 13. While raising her two boys in Scarsdale, Beth earned a Master's degree from the New School of Social Research. Beth was a dedicated mother, wife and grandmother. A lover of the arts and education, she relished being an angel for plays on Broadway and her most passionate charity work included efforts on behalf of Brandeis University, and Skidmore College. She will be greatly missed by husband Donald, sister Judith Hertz, sons Steven and Edward, their wives Moira and Lucinda and grandchildren Leila, Samuel and James. A service in her memory will be held at Frank E. Campbell Funeral Chapel, 1076 Madison Ave., New York, NY at 12pm on Thursday, January 28. 1/3
